sponsor.partnerMessage: Looking to enhance your current skills or pursue a new career in the retail and supplier industry? NWACC's Certified Retail Analyst (CRA) program offers online training to equip you with the knowledge and tools to navigate the retail world. Learn more HERE.

posts.title: City Sessions Announces Summer Series
posts.content:
City Sessions kicks off its 10th season of unexpected, exceptional music experiences with three exciting shows this summer!

  • Country Roots: Hear Adam Hambrick + Common Roots at the Brittain's Home on Jun 30 at 6:30p.
  • Intriguing Indie: Tiny Camper + Will Gunselman perform live at Bike Rack Brewing on Jul 7 at 6:30p.
  • Rockin' Free: Alabama rock group Carver Commodore will play two free shows at Turnbow Park and Bike Rack Brewing on Jul 27-28.

Keep up with City Sessions news HERE.

posts.title: Mount Sequoyah Hosts Second Annual Fayetteville Movement Festival
posts.content:
Mount Sequoyah will host the 2nd annual Fayetteville Movement Festival, featuring a weekend of dance, yoga, functional movement, deep relaxation, live music, and more with movement professionals and local artists, from Jun 30 - Jul 2.

  • Creative movement: Open to people of all ages and backgrounds, the Fayetteville Movement Festival will be a weekend of connecting with the self and the community, building resilience and creativity through movement. Don't miss the Open Mic Night on Friday, hosted by Bxmbi, as poets, musicians, and theatrical performers showcase their talents.
  • Let's get moving: Whether you have previous experience with the art of movement or just getting started and want to feel more in sync with your body, the variety of classes offered this weekend offers something for everyone.

Find tickets and a full schedule of the weekend HERE.

posts.title: Razorback Athletics Hosts NWA Realtor Appreciation Event
posts.content:
Razorback Athletics invites all Northwest Arkansas Realtors to attend a special NWA REALTOR¬Æ Appreciation Event!

  • Gone Clubbin': The free event will take place on Tuesday, Jun 27, from 5-6:30p in the SEC Club of Donald W. Reynolds Razorback Stadium. Parking is available in Lot 44.
  • Mix and Mingle: Hear from Razorback Administration, mingle with other Realtors, enjoy complimentary appetizers and beverages, and even tour the facility. Attendees will also be entered to win door prizes.

RSVP for the NWA REALTOR¬Æ Appreciation Event HERE.

posts.title: Arkansas 211 Receives $100K From Walmart Foundation
posts.content:
The Walmart Foundation has granted Arkansas 211 $100,000 to expand its Ride United: Last Mile Delivery program ‚Äî which distributes healthy food to households in Washington and Benton counties without access.

  • Ride United: The program is a collaborative effort between Arkansas 211, United Way, and DoorDash providing food boxes and other essential supplies through no-cost home deliveries.
  • The final mile: Funding from the Walmart Foundation will expand the program beyond its pilot stage, enabling it to make over 12,000 home deliveries through 2024.

See how you can play a part in the work of Arkansas 211 HERE.

posts.title: Mount Up For The Rodeo Of The Ozarks In Springdale This Week
posts.content:
Saddle up for four nights of rodeo action during the 78th annual Rodeo of the Ozarks at Parsons Stadium in Springdale from Jun 21-24, beginning with the Rodeo Parade down Emma St. on Wednesday, Jun 21, at 10a.

  • Nightly action: Gates open at 5:30p daily with nightly themes like Faith & Family Night, Hispanic Heritage Night, "Rope Your Dreams" Night, and Let Freedom Ring Night.
  • Family fun: Witness heart-stopping rodeo competitions, hear talented musicians, laugh at hilarious clowns, and shop western lifestyle vendors while eating finger-licking-good rodeo food. Sign your kids up for the Mutton Bustin Championship for some real fun!

Check out more about the event and find tickets HERE.
